intro: Cheiranthus canus, commonly known as the hoary bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving the plant a silvery appearance. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
